DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study examine effectiveness lumbopelvic stabilization exercise woman undergone Caesarian section : 1 ) disability use Modified Oswestry Low Back Disability Index ( OSW ) , 2 ) pain accord Numeric Pain Rating Scale ( NPRS ) , 3 ) percent change muscle thickness deep abdominal use ultrasound imaging , 4 ) perceive improvement use Global Rating Change ( GROC ) .
DOC.brief_title: Effectiveness Lumbopelvic Stabilization Exercises Pregnancy-related Low Back Pain
DOC.detailed_description: Pregnancy-related low back pain complex problem . Decreased strength endurance trunk hip muscle show pregnancy-related low back pain . Lumbopelvic stabilization exercise show decrease pain disability low back pain . However , study post-partum woman , specifically undergone Caesarian section birth . The purpose study examine effectiveness lumbopelvic stabilization exercise woman undergone Caesarian section : 1 ) disability use Modified Oswestry Low Back Disability Index ( OSW ) , 2 ) pain accord Numeric Pain Rating Scale ( NPRS ) , 3 ) percent change muscle thickness deep abdominal use ultrasound imaging , 4 ) perceive improvement use Global Rating Change ( GROC ) .
DOC.criteria: Unilateral low back pain near sacroiliac joint ( SIJ ) ( distal and/or lateral L5S1 buttock ) and/or symphysis pubis Pain onset pregnancy within 3 week delivery Most recent delivery within 624 week At least 2/6 positive SIJ provocation test ( thigh thrust , sacral compression , sacral distraction , sacral thrust , Gaenslen 's test ) Positive active straight leg raise ( ASLR ) test . Neurological sign Systemic disease Currently pregnant
